comment.author: 82575904@N00
comment._content:
As a big admirer of the old Egyptian culture and their remains come on us in Egypt and the museums throughout the world, I use these pictures for own studies and the thought-exchange with friends on internet forums.

Thanks for sharing all these wonderful Sets on flickr with us.

at the opportunity a question:  (S10|08 Gizeh, image 9610).
Where this picture was taken in Gizeh, Temple of Isis, Sphinx in front of South Pylon ? It looks like another place or I am mistaken after hundred years?

comment.author: 24141292@N02
comment._content: This appears to be the Temple of Isis at Philae, rather than Gizeh,  I recognise the lion sculpture and the defaced figure of one of the Ptolemies on the pylon in the background. The background has of course changed since the relocation of the Temple in the 1970s.

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Thanks so much for pointing this out - our Egyptologist confirmed and caption has been changed.

comment.author: 9086729@N03
comment._content: Great! i was there 1 month ago and that's beautiful! Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Fuerza y Honor, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 91271949@N00
comment._content: Still not clear what is meant... the title says Gizeh, but the description tells us it's Philae...

comment.author: 14320138@N08
comment._content:
I know that I sound silly but these lions look, to me, quite similar to these of delos, more than what we're used to see, lions sprawled on their side
I dont use there pictures at all
it's just for my pleasure, as, when a kid, I wanted to become an egyptologist
but, later, when an art teacher at the leonardo da vinci's institute of art, could use that love of mine to share with my students during the history of art classes
thank you so much

comment._content: my mistake, just remembered that there were 2 such lions at the cairo museum, of the side, near the fence!
